Ref: Gen 5:3 "And Adam lived an hundred and thirty years, and begat a son in his own likeness, and after his image; and called his name Seth:"

Gen 5:4-5 "And the days of Adam after he had begotten Seth were eight hundred years: and he begat sons and daughters: And all the days that Adam lived were nine hundred and thirty years: and he died."
Gen 5:6 "And Seth lived an hundred and five years, and begat Enos:"
Gen 5:9 "And Enos lived ninety years, and begat Cainan:"
Gen 5:7-8 "And Seth lived after he begat Enos eight hundred and seven years, and begat sons and daughters: And all the days of Seth were nine hundred and twelve years: and he died."
Gen 5:10-11 "And Enos lived after he begat Cainan eight hundred and fifteen years, and begat sons and daughters: And all the days of Enos were nine hundred and five years: and he died."
Gen 5:12 "And Cainan lived seventy years and begat Mahalaleel:"
Gen 5:13-14 "And Cainan lived after he begat Mahalaleel eight hundred and forty years, and begat sons and daughters: And all the days of Cainan were nine hundred and ten years: and he died."
Gen 5:15 "And Mahalaleel lived sixty and five years, and begat Jared:"
Gen 5:18 "And Jared lived an hundred sixty and two years, and he begat Enoch:"

Gen 5:16-17 "And Mahalaleel lived after he begat Jared eight hundred and thirty years, and begat sons and daughters: And all the days of Mahalaleel were eight hundred ninety and five years: and he died."
Gen 5:21 "And Enoch lived sixty and five years, and begat Methuselah:"
Gen 5:19-20 "And Jared lived after he begat Enoch eight hundred years, and begat sons and daughters: And all the days of Jared were nine hundred sixty and two years: and he died."

Gen 5:22-24 "And Enoch walked with God after he begat Methuselah three hundred years, and begat sons and daughters: And all the days of Enoch were three hundred sixty and five years: And Enoch walked with God: and he was not; for God took him."
Gen 5:25 "And Methuselah lived an hundred eighty and seven years, and begat Lamech."
Meaning: man of the dart or his death shall bring judgment

Ref: Gen 5:28-29 "And Lamech lived an hundred eighty and two years, and begat a son: And he called his name Noah, saying, This same shall comfort us concerning our work and toil of our hands, because of the ground which the Lord hath cursed."

Gen 5:26-27 "And Methuselah lived after he begat Lamech seven hundred eighty and two years, and begat sons and daughters: And all the days of Methuselah were nine hundred sixty and nine years: and he died."
Meaning: man of the dart or his death shall bring judgment

Ref: Gen 5:30-31 "And Lamech lived after he begat Noah five hundred ninety and five years, and begat sons and daughters: And all the days of Lamech were seven hundred seventy and seven years: and he died."

Gen 5:32 "And Noah was five hundred years old: and Noah begat Shem, Ham, and Japheth."
Gen 7:6 "And Noah was six hundred years old when the flood of waters was upon the earth."
Note: Noah's sone would not have all been born the same year. Shem would have been born when Noah was 502 given Gen 11:10.
Gen 9:28-29 "And Noah lived after the flood three hundred and fifty years. And all the days of Noah were nine hundred and fifty years: and he died."
Gen 11:10 "These are the generations of Shem: Shem was an hundred years old, and begat Arphaxad two years after the flood:"
Gen 11:12 "And Arphaxad lived five and thirty years, and begat Salah:"
Meaning: I shall fail as the breast

Ref: Gen 11:11 "And Shem lived after he begat Arphaxad five hundred years, and begat sons and daughters."
Gen 11:13 "And Arphaxad lived after he begat Salah four hundred and three years, and begat sons and daughters."
Meaning: I shall fail as the breast

Ref: Gen 11:14 "And Salah lived thirty years, and begat Eber:"
Gen 11:!6 "And Eber lived four and thirty years, and begat Peleg:"
Gen 11:15 "And Salah lived after he begat Eber four hundred and three years, and begat sons and daughters."
Gen 11:17 "And Eber lived after he begat Peleg four hundred and thirty years, and begat sons and daughters."
Gen 11:18 "And Peleg lived thirty years, and begat Reu:"
Gen 11:19 "And Peleg lived after he begat Reu two hundred and nine years, and begat sons and daughters."
Gen 11:20 "And Reu lived two and thirty years, and begat Serug:"
Gen 11:21 "And Reu lived after he begat Serug two hundred and seven years, and begat sons and daughters."
Gen 11:22 "And Serug lived thirty years, and begat Nahor:"
Gen 11:24 "And Nahor lived nine and twenty years, and begat Terah:"
Gen 11:23 "And Serug lived after he begat Nahor two hundred years, and begat sons and daughters."
Gen 11:25 "And Nahor lived after he begat Terah an hundred and nineteen years, and begat sons and daughters."

Gen 11:26 "And Terah lived seventy years, and begat Abram, Nahor, and Haran."
Note: Not all of Terah's sons would have been born the same year. In light of Acts 7:4 and Gen 12:4, Abram was born when Terah was 130 years old.
Gen 21:5 "And Abraham was an hundred years old, when his son Isaac was born unto him."
Gen 11:32 "And the days of Terah were two hundred and five years: and Terah died in Haran."
Gen 25:7 "And these are the days of the years of Abraham's life which he lived, an hundred threescore and fifteen years."
